description: This is a simple tutorial that teaches you the basics of controlling the UI through your flowgraph.

1.description: This is the description for graph New State
1.name: Level Setup

82.commentText: Before loading anything, you should hide\nthe editor (in case it is opened).\n

83.commentText: This is just a basic way to load a level and then spawn a vehicle in that level. \nBecause we enabled the "customLoadingScreen" option in the "Load Level" node, we should use the "Hide Loading Screen" node\nto hide the loading screen after the car has finished spawning.

3.description: This is a simple tutorial that teaches you the basics of controlling the UI through your flowgraph.
3.name: States

23.commentText: This is a simple tutorial that teaches you the basics of controlling the UI through your flowgraph.\nSee the different possibilites by exploring the flowgraphs.

10.description: This is the description for graph New State
10.name: Reset Level

22.commentText:
After your car has been reset to its starting position, you most likely also want to reset the UI.
The "UI Layout" node allows you to choose from different layout options. Not every layout displays every UI element, but "scenario" is a good default.
The "Start Screen" node is a simple way to introduce the player to your level. It displays a windows with a title and a description for your level.
You can use the "Countdown" node to display a countdown on screen with a duration and finish message that you can set yourself.
Make sure to reset the "Countdown" node, if you want to use it multiple times.

13.description: This graph shows you different ways to display text in the UI.
13.name: Main Activities

26.commentText: This groupstate shows you different ways to display text in the UI.\nPress the "Play" button and follow the markers to test how these different\ntypes of messages are displayed in the UI.

35.commentText: Simply transitions out of the groupstate, when the player resets.

21.description: This graph shows you how to use the "Message" node to display text in the UI.
21.name: "Message Node" Showcase

36.commentText: Displays a simpel marker with a trigger that passes flow, when entered.

message.value: This text was created by the "Message" node.

440.commentText: Displays a simple text in the top left corner of the screen\nfor a set duration. Great for giving hints \nor minor information to the player.

25.description: This graph shows you how to use the "RT Message" node to display text in the UI.
25.name: "RT Message" Node Showcase

443.commentText: Displays a simpel marker that activates the "RT Message" node and disables itself\nafter its trigger has been entered by the player.

444.commentText: Displays a simpel marker that deactivates the "RT Message" node and transitions out of the state\nafter its trigger has been entered by the player.

445.commentText: Switches between the "First Map Marker" and the "Second Map Marker" after the first has been entered.

446.commentText: Shows a text in the center of the screen\nuntil it is cleared. Great for displaying permanent\nimportant information that the player should not forget.

45.description: This graph shows you how to use the "Monologue" node to display text in the UI.
45.name: "Monologue Node" Showcase

447.commentText: Displays a simpel marker that activates the "RT Message" node and disables itself\nafter its trigger has been entered by the player.

448.commentText:
Displays a series of texts in the top left corner of the screen similiar to the
"Message" node.
Each text can have an individual duration
and the node needs constant flow to function.

48.description: This graph simple transitions out of the groupstate, when the vehicle is reset.
48.name: Reset State

130.description: This graph shows you how to handle the UI at the end of your level.
130.name: End Screen

38.commentText: You can use the "End Screen" node to display\nan overlay at the end of your level.

499.commentText: Displays a simpel marker with a trigger that passes flow, when entered.

154.description: This graph shows you how to use the "Flash Message" node to display text in the UI.
154.name: "Flash Message" Node Showcase

441.commentText: Displays a simple marker with a trigger that passes flow, when entered.

442.commentText: Shows a text in the center of the screen\nfor a given duration. Great for passing urgent\ninformation to the player that should not be missed.

name: UI Basics
